definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Always ground your opinion on fact.
sentences.chinese: 要永远根据事实而立论。

sentences.english: Along with horary of push forward, he is more and more stubborn to own argumentation.
sentences.chinese: 随着时间的推进，他对自己的立论越来越固执。

sentences.english: The scientific theory should be the theory of unification theory.
sentences.chinese: 刑罚正当根据学说之科学立论是统一论。

sentences.english: I think Joba's injury concerns are well-founded.
sentences.chinese: 我认为张伯伦会受伤是有其立论基础的。

sentences.english: The trouble is that the entire theory may be dead wrong.
sentences.chinese: 问题是整个立论可能是全盘错误。
这是一本立论肤浅的书。

sentences.english: The criteria for its literary criticism are respectively based on two perspectives: collection of historical materials and compilation of historical biographies.
sentences.chinese: 其立论标准，分别基于史料采集与史传编著两个视角。

sentences.english: Therefore the Chinese medicine treats diabetes often by "the three urinary deficiencies" the argument.
sentences.chinese: 所以中医治疗消渴病常以“三消”立论。

definition: to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
to analyze thoroughly, point by point (idiom)
lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
to concentrate on the main points (idiom); to bring out the essentials
